chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: To monitor a specific application based on Anyframe Monitoring Tool, after proceeding with routines as below, Anyframe Monitoring Tool is installed and normal operation should be checked. (Anyframe Monitoring Tool was tested only at IE 6.x)/

section.title: Download
section.para: anyframe.tools.monitoring-x.x.x.war and anyframe.tools.monitoring.agent-x.x.x.zip files. (Except, in the case of war file, if war file is downloaded via Anyframe Open Source Community, file extension can be processed in the zip form, therefore, extension should be changed.) File for downloading is as below.

listitem.para: anyframe.tools.monitoring-agent-x.x.x.zip : Library and property file deployed to monitored application

section.title: WAR file deployment
section.para: In the case that WAS is Tomcat, looked into is the method to deploy Anyframe Monitoring Tool.

listitem.para: Move anyframe.tools.monitoring-x.x.x.war file into in the [Tomcat Home]\webapps folder
If Tomcat server is up and running, decompression will take place automatically.

section.para: In the case of other application servers, you should deploy war file downloaded according to each application server.

section.title: Execution Confirmed
section.para: In the case that WAS is Tomcat, looked into is the method to confirm whether Anyframe Monitoring Tool is executed in the normal fashion.

listitem.para: By executing >[Tomcat Home]\bin\catalina.bat file, Anyframe Monitoring Tool starts.
Check whether Tomcat server starts in the normal fashion via console window.
Enter http://localhost:8080/anyframe.tools.monitoring-1.0.0 in the browser address box and check whether Anyframe Monitoring Tool screen pops up.

When SELECT APPLICATION is selected at upper left in Anyframe Monitoring Tool, popup to select monitored application shows up. If monitored application is not executed, application list will not be searched.

section.title: Test Monitoring
section.para: After downloading anyframe.example.monitoring project provided by this manual, run a test to check whether monitoring is up and running in the normal fashion by implementing Example application (* regarding property definition for monitored application and definition for monitoring object, refer to Configuration.

important.title: Agent Installation for Monitoring
important.para: Bear in mind that to monitor a specific application execution, class path referred by monitored application should add infrared-agent-all-servlet-x.x.x.jar file. Infrared-agent-all-servlet-x.x.x.jar file is included within anyframe.tools.monitoring-agent-x.x.x.zip and downloadable via Anyframe OpenSource Community. Agent library is defined as reference relationship within pom.xml of anyframe.example.monitoring provided by this manual.

listitem.para: When SELECT APPLICATION is chosen at upper left in Anyframe Monitoring Tool, shown are userâ€™s computer name and application name.
After selecting relevant application and clicking OK button, monitoring results can be checked.

After downloading hsqldb.zip including test DB and anyframe.example.monitoring.zip file including example code, decompress them. And by executing start.cmd (or start.sh) file within hsqldb folder, run test DB.
Maven based Execution
Move into decompression folder and then execute the command called mvn jetty:run. If Jetty Server starts in the normal fashion, open a browser and enter http://localhost:8080/anyframe.example.monitoring at address box, confirming execution result.
Eclipse based Execution - m2eclipse, WTP
After decompressing project is imported, click the right button on the mouse and select Maven > Enable Dependency Management on the menu and fix the compiling error. And then after clicking the right button on the mouse, click Run As > Run on Server (Tomcat based) on the context menu. If Tom Server starts in normal fashion, open the browser and enter http://localhost:8080/anyframe.example.monitoring at the address box to confirm the execution result.
Eclipse based Execution - WTP
After decompressing project is imported, reference library is copied into WEB-INF/lib at src/main/webapp folder by executing build.xml. After selecting relevant project, click the right button on the mouse and click Run As > Run on Server on the context menu. If Tomcat Server starts in the normal fashion, open a browser and type in http://localhost:8080/anyframe.example.monitoring at the address box and confirm it. (* For build.xml execution, maven-ant-task-2.0.10.jar file must exist within ${ANT_HOME}/lib.)
